metadata.title: Friday, 15th September, 2023
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) how many boreholes were sunk, countrywide, in 2022;
(b) how many districts benefited from the project;
(c) what criteria were used to allocate the boreholes to each district;
(d) when the Government will sink boreholes in districts that were not considered in 2022;
(e) whether the Government has any plans to set up water supply schemes in 2023; and
(f) if so, which districts will benefit from the project.
(a) whether the Government is aware of the outbreak of cassava brown streak which occurred in March, 2023, in the following wards in Lukashya Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Kapanda; (ii) Lualuo; (iii) Kapongolo; (iv) Musowa; and
(v) Chibunda;
(b) if so, what measures are being taken to assist the affected farmers; and
(c) what measures are being taken to prevent the outbreak of similar diseases in the future.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines and Minerals Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to give the dump sites at Kagem Mine in Lufwanyama Parliamentary Constituency to the local youths; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Rural Development
parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that members of the Local Authorities Superannuation Fund (LASF) have been experiencing challenges in accessing their pension benefits and annuities;
(b) if so, what measures are being taken to address the challenges; and
(c) what measures the Government is implementing to ensure that LASF is sustainable in its current and future operations.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Rural Development
parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that Constituency Development Fund construction projects, countrywide, are being undertaken without the application of Quality Control and Quality Assurance mechanisms; and

(b) if so, what measures are being taken to employ Quality Control and Quality Assurance mechanisms, so as to prevent the construction of substandard structures and avoid wasteful expenditure of public resources.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Arts
parts: (a) how many youth clubs were formed in Nalikwanda Parliamentary Constituency from 2016 to 2021, year by year;
(b) whether the clubs above were empowered by the Government;
(c) if so, what form of empowerment was provided;
(d) if the empowerment was in monetary form, how much money was allocated to each club; and
(e) whether the clubs are monitored to verify whether they are operational.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct communication towers in the following areas in Lundazi Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Dunduzu; (ii) Kabindula; (iii) Nyangwe; (iv) Mukawile;
(v) Ng’onga; and (vi) Kachenche;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why. ORDER OF THE DAY 1. Thanks –His Excellency the President’s Address - Motion (13th September) - Resumption of Debate: (Mr Chanda, MP). ___________________________
